description.narrative: Interventionen Målet är att avsevärt förbättra människorättssituationen i Bangladesh. Programmets syfte är att bidra till inrättandet av ett icke-diskriminerande och demokratiskt samhälle där värdighet, grundläggande fri-och rättigheter för alla medborgare garanteras. Den totala programbudgeten är cirka MSEK 67,0. Sveriges engagemang är cirka 14,3%.

The intervention objective is to significantly improve the human rights situation in Bangladesh. The programme aims to contribute to the establishment of a non-discriminatory and democratic society where dignity, fundamental freedom and rights of all citizens are guaranteed. The total programme budget is approximately MSEK 67,0. Sweden's commitment constitutes roughly 14.3%.

The intervention objective is to significantly improve the human rights situation in Bangladesh. Through the programme, ASK aims to contribute to the establishment of a non-discriminatory and democratic society where dignity, fundamental freedom and rights of all citizens are guaranteed in compliance with the Universal Declaration of Human Rights (UDHR), Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination against Women (CEDAW) and the Constitution of Bangladesh. The successful implementation of the programme will have a positive impact on survivors of human rights violation, especially women and children. In the long run, it will substantially contribute to improving the overall human rights situation in Bangladesh.This programme will particularly focus on women, while other groups to be targeted include working girls and boys, ethnic and religious minorities, and survivors of human rights violations, human rights actors (defenders and duty bearers).The programme has been designed within the framework of the following specific objectives:1. By 2016, human rights standards and mechanisms are increasingly applied by the wider civil society.2. By 2016, access to justice for disempowered people is enhanced.3. By 2016, the accountability of the state to ensure human rights standards is enhanced.4. By 2016, the rights of working children are promoted.To reach these results, the organisation amongst other things will provide free legal aid and mediation services to poor and marginalized people; offer shelter and psycho-social counselling to victims of violence; run drop-in centres for working girls and boys; spread knowledge and raise awareness on human rights; facilitate community activism; monitor the human rights situation, conduct research; and undertake advocacy for law and policy reform and the promotion of international justice issues.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The programme worked to build the capacity of human rights actors in the working areas to ensure human rights standards as well as gender justice for disempowered people. In the completion report from the previous phase , ASK has reported that the initiatives at the grassroots level have significantly raised people’s intolerance of human rights violation and increased people’s participation in the demand for social justice. It was reported that community activism carried out by the women’s groups and lawyers’ forums have led to increased awareness in the communities on the laws and illegal practices such as early marriage and dowry. ASK had contributed to the drafting of the Domestic Violence Act which was passed in 2010. ASK was also active in lobbying with the government to adopt policies and regulations that are effective in eliminating child labour. As a result, the government included a code of conduct as a chapter in the National Child Labour Eradication Policy. The investigation unit of ASK receives requests from the Supreme Court and the National Human Rights Commission (NHRC), which is an indication of ASK’s credibility. ASK’s information and statistical data are also used by journalists, NGOs, government agencies, students, and lawyers. The human rights defenders forums (HRDFs) developed by ASK conduct investigations locally, and pass the cases to ASK and the NHRC. As a result, increased number of human rights violations are reported and investigated. During 2007 – 2010, ASK undertook a number of public interest litigations which have contributed to a number of positive developments. For instance, no person can pronounce fatwa , which violates or affects the rights or reputation or dignity of another person, which is covered by the law of the land.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
